DATA.ELEMENT: class Trilobita (Walch 1771)-> order Proetida (Fortey & Owens, 1975)-> suborder Proetina (Fortey & Owens 1975)-> superfamily Proetoidea (Hawle & Corda, 1847)-> family Proetidae (Salter, 1864)-> subfamily Proetinae (HAWLE & CORDA, 1847)-> genus Gerastos (Goldfuss, 1843)-> Gerastos granulosus (Goldfuss, 1843)

Gerastos granulosus, which is sometimes called Proetus granulosus - small trilobite existed since the Devonian period up to the Upper Permian . It is known from the findings in the Atlas Mountains in Morocco.
The most outstanding feature is the kind of high granularity ( granularity - hence the species name ) its onion- convex glabella - the middle of the head shield - and very short sch�chnye spikes. Length adult trilobite reached 5.5 cm, width 4.5 cm and height of 2.5 cm
Devonian, middle devonian (393.3 � 382.7 Ma), Eifelian stage(393.3 � 387.7 Ma)
